Several extinct species within Suidae are classified in subfamilies other than
Suinae. However, the classification of the extinct members of the Suoideaâthe
larger group that includes the Suidae, the peccary family (Tayassuidae), and
related extinct speciesâis controversial, and different classifications vary in
the number of subfamilies within Suidae and their contents. Grubb, 2005;
McKenna and Bell, 1997, pp. 393â397; Orliac et al., 2010 Some
classifications, such as the one proposed by paleontologist Jan van der Made in
2010, even exclude from Suinae some extant taxa of Suidae, placing these
excluded taxa in other subfamilies. Van der Made, 2010, p. 115
